intro: Coussapoa subincana, commonly known as the velvety waxplant, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or branches. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
